usefulItems: saucepan, dariole moulds, serving plates, baking tray and baking paper, freezer-proof container, freezer, hob
title: Popcorn Ice Cream Dessert

ingredients.content: 1 - 4 tsp fine sea salt, to taste

preparations.content: Place cream, milk, 60 g sugar, egg yolks and vanilla in mixing bowl then cook <b>5 min/80Â°C/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a freezer-proof container and allow to cool then place in freezer for 3-5 hours or until almost set. Clean mixing bowl and continue with recipe.

Place a saucepan over a high heat on hob then add coconut oil and popcorn kernels. Place lid on and gently shuffle kernels inside saucepan until corn starts popping. Once popping has subsided to 1 pop per second, remove saucepan from heat. Remove lid and sprinkle with salt, to taste. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place remaining 200 g sugar in mixing bowl and grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>.
Transfer to a saucepan and add water. Stir constantly over a high heat for 5-6 minutes or until a golden-brown caramel forms.
Pour half of the caramel over the reserved popcorn and stir through then set aside.
Pour remaining caramel in a thin layer onto prepared baking tray. Allow to set before breaking into shards, then set aside.
Remove ice cream from freezer and cut into 4 cm squares. Place ice cream squares in mixing bowl, crush <b>20 sec/speed 9<b> then mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Pour ice cream into 6 dariole moulds and add 3-4 pieces of reserved caramel popcorn to each mould. Freeze for 3-4 hours or until set.
Chill serving plates and remove ice cream from freezer 5 minutes before assembly.
Gently remove ice cream from moulds and place on serving plates. Decorate with a few shards of reserved toffee and remaining caramel popcorn then serve.
